summary: This bill, the Combating International Islamophobia Act, aims to establish an Office within the Department of State to monitor and combat Islamophobia globally. The office, headed by a Special Envoy, will track and address acts of Islamophobia and Islamophobic incitement in foreign countries. It also mandates the inclusion of information on such acts in the State Department's annual reports on human rights practices and international religious freedom, seeking to assess and describe the nature and extent of these incidents, including related governmental actions.
